dublin_core.dcvalue: In nuclear medicine practice images often need to be reviewed and reports prepared from locations outside the department usually in the form of hard copy Although hard copy images are simple and portable they do not offer electronic data search and image manipulation capabilities On the other hand picture archiving and communication systems or dedicated workstations cannot be easily deployed at numerous locations To solve this problem we propose a Java based remote viewing station JaRViS for the reading and reporting of nuclear medicine images using Internet browser technology
Journal of nuclear medicine : official publication, Society of Nuclear Medicine
Java-based remote viewing and processing of nuclear medicine images: toward "the imaging department without walls".
